intro: Scrophularia tmolea, commonly known as the narrowleaf figwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy, often tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which are usually pink to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Scrophularia tmolea is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
